title: Bug 7734 - System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting downWindows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: The system should provide a 'Do you want to save your file' dialog box with options to save or discard changes before shutting down.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command
5. Observe that there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s) and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.
